question: Treatment duration of Multi-bacillary leprosy is:
exp: Multi drug therapy (MDT) of Leprosy: Paucibacillary Leprosy (PBL) Multibacillary Leprosy (MBL) No. of skin lesions <= 5 >= 5 Nerve involvement 0-1 nerve >= 1 nerve Treatment Adults: Day 1: Supervised monthly Rifampicin 600 mg Dapsone 100 mg Day 1: Supervised monthly Rifampicin 600 mg Clofazimine 300 mg Dapsone 100 mg Day 2-28: Daily Dapsone 100 mg Day 2-28; Daily Clofazimine 50 mg, Dapsone 100 mg children b/w 10-14 yrs - Rifampicin -450 mg once a month, supervised - Dapsone -50 mg daily, self administered - Rifampicin - 450 mg once a month, given under supervision - Dapsone - 50 mg daily, self administered - Clofazimine -150 mg once a month supervised & 50 mg every other day. Duration of treatment 6 months 12 months Duration of follow up 2 years 5 years - In children < 10yrs of age, lower doses of Clofazimine & Dapsone are recommended. MDT - Adult

question: In a case of Paucibacillary leprosy, treatment is considered adequate if the patient has received the six monthly doses of combined therapy within:-
exp: Adequate treatment: Patients has received 6 months of PBL therapy in 9 months or 12 months of MBL therapy within 18 months Multi drug therapy (MDT) of Leprosy: Paucibacillary Leprosy (PBL) Multibacillary Leprosy (MBL) No. of skin lesions <= 5 >= 5 Nerve involvement 0-1 nerve >= 1 nerve Treatment Day 1: Supervised monthly Rifampicin 600 mg Clofazimine 300 mg Dapsone 100 mg Day 1: Supervised monthly Rifampicin 600 mg Clofazimine 300 mg Dapsone 100 mg Day 2-28: Daily Dapsone 100 mg Clofazimine 50 mg Day 2-28; Daily Clofazimine 50 mg Dapsone 100 mg Duration of treatment 6 months 12 months Duration of follow up 2 years 5 years

question: 'Dipstick test' for rapid diagnosis of Plasmodium falciparum is based on:-
exp: 'Dipstick test' is used for the rapid diagnosis of plasmodium falciparum: Is a 'rapid whole blood immunochromatographic test'. Uses 2 antibodies specific for 'Pf Histidine Rich Protein II antigen'. Is a 'antigen capture assay'. ALSO REMEMBER: Serological diagnosis of Kala Azar is based on: rk39 antigen. Serological diagnosis of Dengue is based on: NS-1 antigen.

question: Drug of choice for Falciparum Malaria is
exp: Drug of choice for Plasmodium falciparum, plasmodium malariae is ACT (Aemisinin Combination Therapy) + primaquine Doc for plasmodium vivax & ovale - chloroquine + primaquine Also remember chemoprophylaxis of malaria: - Sho term - Doxycycline - Long term - Mefloquine

question: Most efficient anti-larval measures to prevent urban malaria is:
exp: Recommended measures for urban malaria control: Lids of overhead tanks must be checked and maintained monthly basis; any leakage be repaired immediately. Cover-up of underground and open tanks. Open tanks used for animals should be dead dried once in week. Never throw any containers in open which are capable of holding water. Building by-laws be implemented to prevent fault in designs, water flow on roof, gully traps. Open tanks are treated with larvicides on weekly basis. Unused wells either be closed or treated with larvicides. Ornamental tanks, fountains are checked periodically & larvivorous fishes are introduced. Proper drainage, periodic flushing of water logged areas and drainage.

question: Insecticide treated Bed nets (ITBN) are treated with:-
exp: Chemicals used in ITBN programme: synthetic pyretheroids. It includes: Deltamethrin: 2. 5% in dosage of 25 mg/m. Cyfluthrin: 5% in dosage of 50 mg/m. Other insecticides used: permethrin, Lambdacyhalothrin, Etofenprox, a-cypermethrin. Effectiveness of pyrethroids: for 6-12 months.

question: Early reaction of Lepromin test is known as
exp: Lepromin test Test of CMI in leprosy. Early reaction is known as Fernandez reaction (Read at 48 hours). Late reaction is known as Late Mitsuda reaction (Read at 21 days). It is not a diagnostic test.
